intro: Riedlea velutina, commonly known as the velvet riedlea, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers, often arranged in clusters. Riedlea velutina is typically found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
